Please don't make up your own personal definitions.

But you surely would agree that Thanos appearing in Guardians of the Galaxy is a crossover with the Avengers even though it wasn't continuing the story from the Avengers. For that matter, the fact that the orb contained one of the infinity stones was also a crossover in the sense it continued to set up Infinity War.

It doesn't matter which came first. The Kree were introduced on Agents of SHIELD and you learn more about them in Guardians of the Galaxy. Continuing a story from one platform to another is the very definition of crossover.
Do you even watch the show? The second episode involving Sif (Season 2 Episode 12) had her fighting a Kree warrior.
We've already had an episode in Season 2 in which a Kree warrior came to Earth to kill inhumans.
In the broadest definition it is a crossover because it literally connects Agents of SHIELD with what happened in Guardians of the Galaxy.

It's one of the many connections between Earth and the Guardians of the Galaxy. Peter Quill is one. The fact that the Kree have visited both Earth and Xandar is another. Thanos being responsible for the Chitari attack is a third.
The voice of Sharkface?

It would make sense if the upcoming Inhumans series were to cross over with Agents of SHIELD.
It would make sense for Agents of SHIELD to crossover with Runaways, Cloak and Dagger or the Netflix shows.
It would make sense for Runaways, Cloak and Dagger or the Netflix shows to crossover with Captain America or Ant Man.
Captain America or Ant Man crossing over with Iron Man or Spider-Man? We actually had that movie less than a year ago.
Captain America, Ant Man, Iron Man and Spider-Man meeting Doctor Strange and the Guardians of the Galaxy? Yeah, that movie is coming out next year.
What would NOT make sense is for Coulson to show up on Xandar and interact with the Nova Corps. Hell, it wouldn't even make sense for the Punisher to show up in Infinity War. To all those people saying "Wouldn't it be cool if the Punisher showed up in Infinity War with a rattling gun and started shooting Thanos?": No.
What we need is an ideograph to show how connected things already are. (Coulson has met the Avengers and Sif. Doctor Strange has already met Thor.)
Actually, technically, Agents of SHIELD has already crossed over with Guardians of the Galaxy because we have had a few episodes with the Kree and the Kree have only showed up on Guardians of the Galaxy and Agents of SHIELD.

I think the Agents of SHIELD series will end with Coulson dying again. Steve Rogers becomes the new Director of SHIELD. I find it odd that the actor playing Jeffrey Mace isn't a regular on the show. I think Coulson will become director again before the shoe ends. Steve Rogers will assume a role like Nick Fury did in the Avengers movies. He can lead a team of agents including Black Widow, Hawkeye, the Winter Soldier, Falcon, War Machine, Ant Man, Wasp and Quake. Tony Stark will have his own team which includes Spider-Man, Quasar, Nova, Ms Marvel, Kate Bishop, White Tiger, Yo-yo and Patriot and Doctor Strange will have his own team that includes Captain Marvel, Scarlet Witch, Thor, Black Panther, Valkyrie, Namor, She-Hulk and the Hulk. I don't want movies with Doctor Octopus, Sandman, Lizard and Electro again. It makes sense to introduce these characters on Netflix or not at all. They could have origin stories for each of the villains and have each of them face Spider-Man. Eventually, the Sinister Six comes together, perhaps when Mysterio breaks the rest of them out of jail. I imagine they could have Mysterio and Kraven in the next Spider-Man movie so that general audiences will know who they are and they could have the Sinister Six in the third Spider-Man movie. Tom Holland wouldn't have to appear on Netflix because Spider-Man wears a mask. Same is true of the Vulture. The Vulture's origin is supposedly being told in the movies so that's not a problem.
I am one with the Asahi and the Asahi is with me.

1. Moon Knight
As a follow up to The Punisher, Thunderbolt Ross recruits Frank Castle to join The Thunderbolts. Marc Spector is also in the group. In a mission in Egypt, things go wrong and Marc Spector becomes Moon Knight.
2. Spider-Woman
Spider-Woman was a Hydra agent who gets captured by Thunderbolt Ross' people and recruited into the Thunderbolts.
3. Elektra
Elektra is also a member of the Thunderbolts. She, Moon Knight and Spider-Woman may have their own spin off series (plural).
4. Mockingbird, Hunter and Brother Voodoo
These three characters can complete the line up in the first season of the Thunderbolts.
5. Ghost Rider
This would be the Robbie Reyes Ghost Rider introduced on Agents of SHIELD. Nicholas Cage could return as Johnny Blaze and be a mentor for Robbie Reyes.
6. Blade and Hannibal King
There are two possibilities: they could recast Blade and have Hannibal King be a minor character or they could bring back Wesley Snipes, recast Hannibal King and have Blade be a mentor for Hannibal King.
7. Jennifer Kale and Danny Ketch
These two characters would be supporting characters in the Ghost Rider series and they could also be part of the Midnight Sons with Ghost Rider and Blade.
8. Norman Osborn and Wilson Fisk
I picture Norman Osborn running for President with Wilson Fisk as either a political rival or running mate.
9. Dark Avengers (Abomination, Venom, Beetle, Moonstone, Blizzard, Lizard)
After the election, the Thunderbolts refuse to work for the US government so they are replaced by the Dark Avengers. The second season of the Thunderbolts has the Thunderbolts fighting the Dark Avengers and taking down the entire administration.
10. Sinister Six (Doctor Octopus, Sandman, Vulture, Electro, Kraven, Mysterio)
The Sinister Six, if it is ever made, would work better as a Netflix series than as a movie. Obviously arrangements would have to be made with Sony.

Thor 4: Thor is defeated in battle by Beta Ray Bill who then gains the power of Thor. Odin has a new hammer forged from matter from a neutron star. Thor and Beta Ray Bill team up to defeat the Chitari who are attacking Beta Ray Bill's home world.
Captain America 4: Captain America passes his shield to a new hero named Patriot. Meanwhile, Winter Soldier and Falcon are on a mission for SHIELD and they get captured by Modok which then requires Captain America and Patriot to come in and save the day.
Iron Man 4: Tony Stark adapts Kree and Xandarian technology and builds two new suits. He does not want to be Iron Man anymore so he gives the suits to Wendal Vaughn and Richard Rider and they are called Quasar and Nova. When War Machine is captured by the Mandarin, Tony suits up one last time to save his friend and brings his proteges with him.
Black Widow: Black Widow and Hawkeye are training new Avengers recruits White Tiger and Kate Bishop. SHIELD assigns them a mission that requires them to steal information from a computer in Kazakhstan. They have to fight a team of winter soldiers.
Punisher's release date is rumored to be December, 2017.

I had a dream last night about you. Seriously.
First of all, I feel I need to explain. I was told back when I was in school that, in some parts of Africa, fat women are considered desirable and that having a fat wife is a sign that a man is wealthy. This is apparently true. http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2364060/Force-fed-husband-How-Mauretanian-women-fattened-like-foie-gras-geese-dangerous-animal-growth-hormones-satisfy-mens-love-larger-lady.html
Anyway, in my dream I was a bigamist and you and Rihanna were my wives. We traveled to Africa and the local men were laughing because I ONLY had two wives. They also said that my wives were really skinny. One guy said that his wife was heavier than both my wives combined and he challenged me to a weigh off to prove his point. You and Rihanna didn't speak the local language and you were confused about what was going on so I explained that the locals wanted to know how much you weighed and the two of you went along with it.
Anyway, they weighed the guy's wife and she was pretty heavy. Then it was your turn. You and Rihanna were going to be weighed together. You and Rihanna were wearing heavy jewelry, however, and some of the locals complained. They began to chant in English "Take it off! Take it off!".
Well, then, of course, because neither of you understood what they were saying until that point, you misunderstood and both started stripping off everything in an amazingly erotic fashion. The locals fell dead silent.
The moral of the story is that it doesn't matter how many wives you have or how heavy they are: what matters at the end of the day is how hot she is / they are.
This was an actual dream I had last night. I kid you not.

I personally had a hard time getting through Jessica Jones so I would say DD S2 DD S1 JJ LC. Basically the last two episodes of Jessica Jones were better than the last two episodes of Luke Cage. Luke Cage was, to a great extent, a sequel to Jessica Jones in that we learned more about Reva Conners and what was on that flash drive.
I preferred Season 2 of Daredevil to Season 1 because there was more going on: Season 1 had Stick, the Hand and Kingpin but Season 2 also had Punisher and Elektra. Again, Season 2 was clearly a natural progression from Season 1. We even had Irish gangsters in Season 2 to replace the Russian gangsters in Season 1 and a stairwell fight in Season 2 to replace the hallway fight in Season 1.

"Mark Ruffalo has also teased a more conscious Hulk, indicating that the relationship between Bruce Banner and his alter ego is transforming.
"When asked how that may play out in the film, Waititi replied, It's interesting, because at the moment, there's a big conversation that's happening about how far to push that. Whether or not The Hulk should be [verbal/conscious].
"I think a lot of those conversations have more to do with what's going to come up in future movies, Waititi continued. So I think a lot of those decisions are larger group decisions, rather than anything to do with just me or the writer. They have a lot of stuff that they have to consider. This will never end. "Where was Doctor Strange when Spider-Man was fighting the Vulture? Where was Spider-Man when Doctor Strange was facing Nightmare?" That's what people will be saying in the coming years. In reality, different groups deal with different threats.

At some point they need to establish separate Avengers teams so that Avengers movies don't have 20 characters each.
First of all, Captain America and Iron Man, assuming neither of them are killed in Infinity War. These guys have been the focus of eight movies already. Even if the actors weren't expensive, we are going to want to shift the focus to younger actors who can lead their own franchises in the future.
Captain America is going to have a role in the newly reformed SHIELD. Perhaps Jeffrey Mace steps down as Director of SHIELD and Captain America becomes Director of SHIELD. He would take over the role in the movies previously filled by Nick Fury. They might even be able to finally get a Captain America cameo on Agents of SHIELD.
Tony Stark in the comics became Secretary of Defense. 2016 was an election year and if President Ellis did not get re-elected then Thunderbolt Ross is probably not Secretary of State so Tony Stark could take over that role. It does seem silly though making the one person who needs the most oversight the actual overseer.
Black Widow is supposed to be getting her own movie in Phase 4. Most likely it will involve aliens or time travel or aliens and time travel and it will set up the next major Avengers movie. If Ghost in the Shell becomes a franchise then she could be busy. Expect a Black Widow movie, if it happens, to be a one off, not because she isn't popular but because there aren't a lot of good Black Widow stories from the comics.
Captain Marvel's movie, if successful, will become a trilogy. It is very unlikely that they will introduce her and immediately kill her off so expect her to be around for a while.
Ant Man and the Wasp will also be in the New Avengers. Marvel likes making trilogies so imagine Ant Man 3 will have Taskmaster as the villain (if he is not already slated to appear in Ant Man and the Wasp). Another possible villain would be Egghead. Better yet, they could have Egghead be the villain for the flashbacks with Hank Pym and Janet Van Dyne and then have Egghead appear at the end as an old man and have him be behind whatever problem they face in present day.
War Machine will stay in the Avengers. In case you missed it, Rhodey was walking at the end of Civil War and even if he is limping for the rest of his life, he doesn't need his legs to operated the War Machine suit.
Falcon, likewise, will remain in the New Avengers. I don't expect Winter Soldier to return. He is a bit of a one note character, what with his metal arm and all. Yes, it might be good to see him redeemed but he also deserves a chance at a normal life.
Tom Holland is signed on for two more Spider-Man movies after Homecoming but the actor is still young so I suspect he could do as many as nine Spider-Man movies when all is said and done, not including Spider-Man centric Avengers movies. Most likely though the MCU will get rebooted after he's done just six solo movies so they can do more movies with Spider-Man in high school (and with what will by then be a cheaper actor).
Nova and/or Quasar will probably be introduced during Infinity War. If they are both introduced then they will complete the roster of the New Avengers for now, although obviously they could add characters like Ms. Marvel later.
Dr. Cho and Prof. Selvig will remain as supporting characters. Jane Foster and her friends won't be seen again.
Thor will probably stay in Asgard and it makes sense for the Hulk to also stay in Asgard. The Hulk is probably still wanted for what happened in Johannesburg. Most likely if Hulk and Thor appear again it will be because Doctor Strange went to Asgard to get them.
Doctor Strange 2 is supposedly going to feature Nightmare. Doctor Strange 3 may very well have Dormammu return and Doctor Strange will call on the help of the Avengers including Hulk and Thor. It would be good if they could also have Namor appear. If you've read any Marvel comics from the seventies then you know why.
Valkyrie is going to appear in Thor Ragnarok along with Thor, Hulk and Doctor Strange. She is also a major character from the seventies.
The New Avengers are a bit crowded so I can see Hawkeye hanging out with Doctor Strange. First of all, I can see Hawkeye, as a SHIELD agent, being asked to look into this magic stuff that Doctor Strange is doing. Expect a lot of reaction shots from Jeremy Renner when Doctor Strange does cool stuff.
Similarly, the Black Panther is the king of Wakanda. He isn't going to hang out in New York with the New Avengers. If anything, Doctor Strange will go grab him when he is needed.
She-Hulk is a character that can join Doctor Strange's Mighty Avengers. Basically, the Leader will use Bruce Banner's blood to make Hulks but Jennifer Walters will fight on the side of good. Scarlet Witch may seek out Strange's help to control her powers. It isn't clear if her magic is really different from Doctor Strange's magic. Presumably he and Wong can teach her to do new things.
Tina Minoru, if she didn't die off screen in Doctor Strange, could potentially be one of the Mighty Avengers. She would take the place of Clea and could potentially be a love interest for Doctor Strange. She could also be the guardian of the Hong Kong Sanctum and thus Strange's equal. We also don't know who the new guardian of the London Sanctum will be. It could be Doctor Druid or it could be Brother Voodoo. My vote is for Doctor Druid and have Brother Voodoo show up in some other capacity.
Sif, Heimdall, the Warriors Three and the Guardians of the Galaxy would show up as supporting characters in future films. Future MCU storylines could involve a Fisk presidency, an Osborn presidency, the Skrulls, Korvac, Avengers from the future coming back in time or a Kree / Xandar war.
There's also the question of who gets what Infinity Stone after Avengers: Infinity War. I imagine Strange keeps the time stone, Asgard gets back the stone from the tesseract, Captain Marvel keeps a stone, the Guardians keep a stone and the other two stone would most likely be guarded by Tina Minoru (if she's still alive) and Doctor Druid. They could also rebuild the Vision and have him guard the Mind Stone. I think killing the Vision in Infinity Wars and then using the Infinity Stones to rebuild the Vision creates the feeling that there are no consequences. You would also have to ask why the Scarlet Witch would bring back the Vision and not Quicksilver.
It would be cool if Guardians 3 ended with the Guardians using an Infinity Stone to freeze the Kree and Xandar armies and then send them back to their respective planets so that they can give negotiations a chance. Of course, that begs the question as to why they were fighting in the first place. Why were they fighting in the past? What were the issues?
Eventually, the current actors will become too old. There's no need to panic however. Feige seems bound and determined to tell all the old Avengers stories from the past. The TV shows are rapidly becoming their own thing. The most likely TV / movie crossover would be to have Wilson Fisk and Norman Osborn working together. Or maybe they will be trying to take each other out. Just don't expect a movie with hundreds of characters because it just wouldn't be worth the effort.
I would introduce Raven on Supergirl and have her recruit heroes from her universe, Earth 1, Earth 2 and Earth 3 to fight against Trigon who is invading Earth-38. Simple.
The porn industry needs to start doing XXX parodies of TV shows to address the needs of people like you.

Are the going to bring back Olicity? Sure. Because it's a TV show. And here's the thing, here's the bottom line: You don't always get what you want. Sitting there, feeling unhappy about the state of the show... They're still on the air; they're still having moments of quality. It could be cancelled. I mean, couldn't it? And if Laurel is Black Siren? Well, that's an improvement, isn't it? The comic book character has powers and so should Black Canary on the show. Arrow is about more than just Olicity and if you let it become just that one thing, you miss the bigger picture. Does that make sense? I mean, if Ollie and Laurel walk off into the sunset then what happens next? Same with Ollie and Felicity. Arrow saving the city is always going to be more important than who Ollie is sleeping with. I'm more interested in seeing what new characters DC is going to let them use in the coming year and how they are going to use those characters in the next crossover.

I think men, as a general rule, feel frustrated that they can't have sex any time they like or, for that matter, with anyone they like. If a man is in a monogamous relationship then he has to wait until his partner is in the mood. One solution would be to marry someone who is horny all the time but, frankly, that can get exhausting after a few months. An AI sex robot would be ideal because you could literally turn it on when you need to relieve a sexual urge. It would also be prohibitively expensive. Under the circumstances, I'm sure you would understand where I am coming from when I say I sometimes fantasize about owning sex slaves or, equivalently, having access to a brothel full of pre-paid hookers.

I get it. Thing is, you can't tell a person "Spend all of your time with me". You don't own them. They are free to come and go.
At the place where you work, what is the policy regarding you fraternizing with customers? If somebody wants to take you out when you aren't working, is that possible or would it get you fired? These guys are probably lonely too. Now, granted, they might think you are an easy lay because you're stripping so you might want to set some ground rules. Don't bring them to your place because they could be stalkers. Don't go to their place because you're giving them all the advantages. Insist you meet them at in a decent, neutral environment where there are other people and you are less likely to be murdered.
